metadata.synopsis: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_Thieflings_Knows_PlayerRobbed4. SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_Thieflings_State_HoldingStolen Goods5. teleport S_DEN_ThiefHideoutLeader6. Speak to Mol

18.speaker: Mol
18.text: Well, look who's come to visit.

131.speaker: Mol
131.text: My kids say you've been busy since you got here.

60.speaker: Mol
60.text: You let that adventurer hit Meli.

185.speaker: Mol
185.text: You scared the life out of little Silfy.

152.speaker: Mol
152.text: Now, you're going to pay for it.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You're about as intimidating as a flail snail in a salt mine.

154.speaker: Mol
154.text: You think that's funny? Fine, laugh at this.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I don't think I'll be paying for anything. Bye for now!

126.speaker: Player
126.text: You're right. I won't mess with any of your gang again. Promise.

153.speaker: Mol
153.text: Still, you got Arabella out of that mess with the druids.

134.speaker: Mol
134.text: Still, you helped Meli get away from the adventurer.

143.speaker: Mol
143.text: Still, you showed you're one of us by taking Mattis' ring. Never saw you coming, did he?

83.speaker: Mol
83.text: Still, you gave Mattis' ring back. Taught him a lesson doing it, too.

7.speaker: Mol
7.text: Still, you went easy on Silfy even though you caught her in your pockets.

67.speaker: Mol
67.text: And for that, you get one more chance.

179.speaker: Mol
179.text: Still, one of my guards said you were nice to him.

53.speaker: Mol
53.text: Still, you've been a friend to us so far.

214.speaker: Mol
214.text: Nobody messes with my family - I'm all they've got.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I didn't mean to cause trouble for your people. Should have been more careful.

103.speaker: Mol
103.text: Is that right? Fine, you get one more chance.
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: A beat, she stares the player down. NodeContext: A beat, she stares the player down.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: You're pests, the lot of you. Stay out of my way, or else.

68.speaker: Mol
68.text: That's the way you want it? Fine.

115.speaker: Mol
115.text: I'll go tell the guards you're pushing us around. See you around, chump.

124.speaker: Mol
124.text: Ugh, get out of my head!

19.speaker: Mol
19.text: That's it. I'm telling the guards what you did. Everything you did!

112.speaker: Player
112.text: If you don't get out of my way, I'll tear your spine out, whelp.

212.speaker: Mol
212.text: ...Fine. But make any more trouble for us and you'll regret it, drow or not.
212.context: NodeContext: A flicker of hesitation. She's just been intimidated by a drow player into letting their interference slide. She tries to mask it with a tough act.

21.speaker: Mol
21.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

8.speaker: Mol
8.text: My gang says you've been messing with them. Don't deny it.

158.speaker: Mol
158.text: And I hear you have a problem.

130.speaker: Mol
130.text: A few things are missing from your pack. Is that right?

191.speaker: Mol
191.text: I heard you helped Meli with that locket. I owe you for that.

123.speaker: Mol
123.text: Mirkon says you got him out of a tight spot with some harpies. Gotta say, I'm impressed.

75.speaker: Mol
75.text: You saved Arabella from the druids. Don't know what those bastards would have done.

118.speaker: Mol
118.text: And thanks for going easy on Silfy. Not many marks would've done the same.

169.speaker: Mol
169.text: I appreciate you teaching Mattis a lesson, too. Kid should be more careful with his rings.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Why're you running all these schemes and swindles? Risky, you know.

149.speaker: Mol
149.text: I appreciate you teaching Mattis a lesson, too. Kid should be more careful with his rings.

69.speaker: Mol
69.text: And we're happy to be helped. Now, what can I do for you?

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You'd better keep these kids in check. They won't get off so lightly forever.

202.speaker: Mol
202.text: Is that a fact? I'll tell them to watch their step.
202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed by player threat. NodeContext: Sarcastic, unimpressed

102.speaker: Player
102.text: What're you doing down in this cave?

109.speaker: Mol
109.text: Making sure we're ready to leave when the time comes.

140.speaker: Mol
140.text: Anyway. You want to talk? Talk.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: What're you doing down in this cave?

79.speaker: Mol
79.text: Making sure we're ready to leave when the time comes.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: Why're you running all these schemes and swindles? Risky, you know.

86.speaker: Mol
86.text: We're saving up for a better hideout when we get to Baldur's Gate.

138.speaker: Mol
138.text: Why, you planning on telling me stealing is wrong?

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Yes. You're taking advantage during bad times. There are words for folk like that.

106.speaker: Mol
106.text: So what? Should we be panicking like everyone else?

161.speaker: Mol
161.text: We have a plan. We're the ones who'll end up on top in the Gate. Anything else?

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Quite the opposite. I want to invest in the newest thieves' guild on the Sword Coast. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

72.speaker: Mol
72.text: Won't turn down free money. I've got operating costs you wouldn't believe.

197.speaker: Mol
197.text: Come see me in the city sometime, huh? I'll repay this and then some.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Not at all. You've got foresight - that'll help you to survive.

104.speaker: Mol
104.text: Foresight's the least of what we've got going, but thanks.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I'm not your parent. Do as you please.

180.speaker: Mol
180.text: Didn't need your permission, but fine.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Thought you might need help with something.

194.speaker: Mol
194.text: Nothing comes to mind. Always eager to accept donations, though.
194.context: NodeContext: with a shrug and a smile

201.speaker: Mol
201.text: I do, as a matter of fact. Revenge.

114.speaker: Mol
114.text: The bastards that killed Arabella. She was a precious little thing; like a sister to me.

150.speaker: Mol
150.text: I want to steal that big shiny idol they're all chanting at.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: An idol? What'll you do with something like that?

165.speaker: Mol
165.text: The important thing is to get it away from them. That ritual's gonna get us all killed.

181.speaker: Mol
181.text: And we can sell it once we get to the city. Might be worth enough to pay a priest to bring Arabella back.

173.speaker: Mol
173.text: And we can sell it once we get to the city. Thing like that's gotta be worth a small fortune.
173.context: NodeContext: serious with a touch of excitement

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I could help you get it, but my time's valuable to me.

55.speaker: Mol
55.text: Sure. When we sell it in the city, I'll make sure you get your cut.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: I'll see what I can do.

159.speaker: Mol
159.text: Be careful. They look brittle as old bark, but they're vicious.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Count me out - I'm not getting involved.

145.speaker: Mol
145.text: Figures. Don't think you've got the stones for the job anyhow.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: That 'big shiny idol' is part of a sacred ritual. Don't you have any respect?

9.speaker: Mol
9.text: They're murderers. I'd spit in the eye of any god the likes of them worship.

39.speaker: Mol
39.text: That ritual's nothing more than a fancy way to kick us out and leave us for dead.
39.context: NodeContext: irritated, sarcasm and scorn on 'ritual'

151.speaker: Mol
151.text: You saw what those bastards that run the place were doing to Arabella. Scaring the precious mite.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: I'm shy a few of my belongings - one of your associates robbed me.

207.speaker: Mol
207.text: Maybe one of the kids picked up something of yours by mistake. I couldn't say.

78.speaker: Mol
78.text: Might help if you pay the inspection fee. I could take a look. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

77.speaker: Mol
77.text: Might help if you pay the inspection fee. I could take a look. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

144.speaker: Mol
144.text: Much appreciated. Let's take a look.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Give me what's mine, or I'll rip your bloody tail off.

70.speaker: Mol
70.text: Threats, huh? The stones on you. Have it your way.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cocked head at the threat. Not frightened. NodeContext: A beat before the line, thoughtful, surprised.

17.speaker: Mol
17.text: You idiot. What comes next is on you.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I'm sure this was a misunderstanding. My things cost me a lot... I really need them back.

85.speaker: Mol
85.text: Honesty and politeness. I like that.

76.speaker: Mol
76.text: You know what else costs a lot? That inspection fee.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] set as rerecord to make sure it flows well into new following lineNodeContext: Emphatic, implying the player needs to pay the fee.

132.speaker: Mol
132.text: I forgot it went up a tenday ago. Anyway, pay up, and I'll see what I can do. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

182.speaker: Player
182.text: Don't be ridiculous. I'm not giving you anything.

170.speaker: Mol
170.text: Then I'm not looking for your stuff. That was easy. Anything else?

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Looks like some of my possessions have gone 'missing'. Again.

93.speaker: Mol
93.text: Sure. Silfy probably grabbed them by mistake.
93.context: NodeContext: Playing innocent. Silfy stole the items on purpose.

65.speaker: Mol
65.text: Sure. Silfy probably grabbed them by mistake.
65.context: NodeContext: Playing innocent. Silfy stole the items on purpose.

177.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Snaps her fingers, holding out a hand, and a bag is handed to her. She gives it to the player.|

6.speaker: Mol
6.text: Here you go. Won't happen again.

91.speaker: Mol
91.text: And to make sure none of the kids on the job outside mess with you, show them this:

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm not joining your little criminal gang.

116.context: CinematicNodeContext: |PC mimics the hand gesture right.|

90.speaker: Mol
90.text: You got it. Now, we done here or what?

1.context: CinematicNodeContext: |PC mimics the hand gesture wrong.|

196.speaker: Mol
196.text: We took this off you before. Some of it's missing, feels like. But there you go.

204.speaker: Mol
204.text: Ready to pay that inspection fee now? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

10.speaker: Player
10.text: There's nothing else to be said, for now.

121.speaker: Mol
121.text: You got your junk back. Take it and get out.

30.speaker: Mol
30.text: Well, it's been a pleasure. You know the way out.

178.speaker: Player
178.context: InternalNodeContext: The idol was moved out of the expected triggers, the player has it and gives it

33.speaker: Mol
33.text: Thanks. See you in Baldur's Gate, I hope. Now scram, before I get emotional.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I didn't touch the idol. Don't know what happened to it.
43.context: InternalNodeContext: The idol was moved out of the expected triggers, the player has it and tries to lie about it

45.speaker: Mol
45.text: Damn it. Having that stashed away would have made life a lot easier.
45.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed. Possible stamp of the foot on 'damn it'. Clenched fists.

111.speaker: Mol
111.text: You're a terrible liar. We had a deal.
111.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed - player just lied to her and she saw right through it.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: And now the deal's off. See you around.

171.speaker: Mol
171.text: Fine. Hope the damn thing's cursed.
171.context: NodeContext: frustrated, but not shouting, as she's dismissed. The 'damn thing' is an idol the player stole and refused to give to her

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Here's some free advice, more valuable than gold: don't bargain, just take.

89.speaker: Mol
89.text: Sounds more like a challenge than advice. Keep an eye on your pack.
89.context: NodeContext: frustrated but with a hint of admiration. Last line is a threat to rob us in the future (pack is backpack). We just conned her, but she learned something from us.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Do you have anything to trade?

97.speaker: Mol
97.text: If you change your mind about that fee, you know where to find me.

44.speaker: Mol
44.text: Don't come back unless you want to talk business.

193.speaker: Mol
193.text: You've been a friend to us. Come back any time.

190.speaker: Mol
190.text: Maybe we can do something about this.
190.context: NodeContext: About to scam the player

136.speaker: Mol
136.text: Anyway. You want to talk? Talk.

4.speaker: Mol
4.text: I told you to leave. What happens next is your fault.

35.speaker: Mol
35.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I don't even know what your business is.

11.speaker: Mol
11.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

148.speaker: Mol
148.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Nothing piques my interest more than being told to stay away from somewhere.

167.speaker: Mol
167.text: We have that in common, then. But you aren't welcome here.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Poking your nose in other people's business is the best way to get rich, I find.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You ready to tell me what sort of racket you're running down here?

42.speaker: Mol
42.text: We have nothing to talk about.

175.speaker: Mol
175.text: I told you to leave. What happens next is your fault.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I go where I like - told you already. And I'll tell you again if I have to.

208.speaker: Mol
208.text: Fine, then. What happens next is your fault.

29.speaker: Mol
29.text: I had a feeling you'd be back.

82.speaker: Mol
82.text: You. Godsdammit, I warned you to stay away from my kids.

206.speaker: Mol
206.text: What comes next is on you.

87.speaker: Mol
87.text: I'm done with you. You better hope we don't have to talk again.

120.speaker: Mol
120.text: I had a feeling you'd be back.

213.speaker: Mol
213.text: Had a feeling you'd be back.
